de.mrapp.android.preference

Class AbstractValidateableDialogPreference<ValueType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.preference.Preference
      • de.mrapp.android.preference.AbstractDialogPreference
        • de.mrapp.android.preference.AbstractValidateableDialogPreference<ValueType>
  • Type Parameters:
    ValueType - The type of the values, which can be validated
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, de.mrapp.android.dialog.DialogValidator, de.mrapp.android.validation.Validateable<ValueType>, java.lang.Comparable<android.preference.Preference>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EditTextPreference, ResolutionPreference

    public abstract class AbstractValidateableDialogPreference<ValueType>
extends AbstractDialogPreference
implements de.mrapp.android.dialog.DialogValidator, de.mrapp.android.validation.Validateable<ValueType>
    An abstract base class for all dialog preferences, which can be validated.
    Since:
    1.2.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractValidateableDialogPreference

        public AbstractValidateableDialogPreference(@NonNull
                                            android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new dialog preference, which can be validated.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • AbstractValidateableDialogPreference

        public AbstractValidateableDialogPreference(@NonNull
                                            android.content.Context context,
                                            @Nullable
                                            android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet)
        Creates a new dialog preference, which can be validated.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available

      • AbstractValidateableDialogPreference

        public AbstractValidateableDialogPreference(@NonNull
                                            android.content.Context context,
                                            @Nullable
                                            android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                                            @AttrRes
                                            int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new dialog preference, which can be validated.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • AbstractValidateableDialogPreference

        public AbstractValidateableDialogPreference(@NonNull
                                            android.content.Context context,
                                            @Nullable
                                            android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                                            @AttrRes
                                            int defaultStyle,
                                            @StyleRes
                                            int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new dialog preference, which can be validated.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet or null, if no attributes are available
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

    • Method Detail

      • onPrepareValidateableDialog

        protected abstract void onPrepareValidateableDialog(@NonNull
                                                    de.mrapp.android.dialog.MaterialDialog.Builder dialogBuilder)
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses when the preference's dialog is about to be created. The builder, which is passed as a method parameter may be manipulated by subclasses in order to change the appearance of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        dialogBuilder - The builder, which is used to create the preference's dialog, as an instance of the class MaterialDialog.Builder

      • getValidationListeners

        protected final java.util.Set<de.mrapp.android.validation.ValidationListener<ValueType>> getValidationListeners()
        Returns the listeners, which are notified when the view, which is contained by the preference's dialog, has been validated.
        Returns:
        A set, which contains the listeners, which are notified when the view, which is contained by the preference's dialog, has been validated, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no validators are used

      • getHelperText

        public final java.lang.CharSequence getHelperText()
        Returns the helper text of the view, which is contained by the preference's dialog.
        Returns:
        The helper text of the view, which is contained by the preference's dialog, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no helper text is shown

      • onPrepareDialog

        protected final void onPrepareDialog(@NonNull
                                     de.mrapp.android.dialog.MaterialDialog.Builder dialogBuilder)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDialogPreference
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses when the preference's dialog is about to be created. The builder, which is passed as a method parameter may be manipulated by subclasses in order to change the appearance of the dialog. When views are inflated inside this method, the context of the builder should be used in order to ensure that the dialog's theme is used.
        Specified by:
        onPrepareDialog in class AbstractDialogPreference
        Parameters:
        dialogBuilder - The builder, which is used to create the preference's dialog, as an instance of the class MaterialDialog.Builder
